title: Amazing Facts About Dubai (TravelDuniya)
text: By TravelDuniya Jul 1, 2015 Dubai a commercial hub and a pivotal centre for cultural activities in the Middle-East. The place is constantly changing and upgrading its tourism infrastructure. The new destination keeps on startling the backpackers visiting there. The place annually entertains the herds of tourists. Every year thousands of travelers look forward to their maiden visit to the affluent city. With development constantly taking place 24x7, TravelDuniya.com brings 10 thrilling facts that will help in discovering the place easier.Crain Real estate in on the boom in Dubai. The city is covered with skyscrapers and is home to some of the world's modern architectural grandeur. The Burj-al-Arab, and Burj-Khalifa are a perfect example of the boom in real estate. This is the reason that one out of four cranes operated on the earth is located in Dubai. Backpackers can explore the stunning destination with Dubai holiday packages. Low crime rateDubai is known for its low crime rate. Due to the stringent law, the city is considered one of the safest city on the planet. The crime rate is as low as 0 percent. Zero Percent TaxSo if you want to become wealthy why not travel to Dubai where you can earn and save a lot of money.Enough Sand to Fill The Empire State Building TwiceIt could only be done in Dubai. Famed for their artificially build archipelago Islands known as Palm Jumeirah and Jebel Ali. Both the island are built with a sand that could easily fill the iconic Emirate State building twice. Discover the island and enjoy the wonderful holiday in Dubai.More Foreigners Than LocalsThe Emirate city is home to about 85% of the foreign population. Most of them are hardworking labourers coming from India, Pakistan and Bangladesh. An Autocratic StateDubai is a monarch. The state is autocratic and controlled by the monarch family. Fourth Richest Country in the worldThe remarkable economic boom and liberal business policies have made Dubai the fourth richest country in the world. 365 Maximum Sunny DaysWith little or no precipitation, Dubai is the place where there are 365 days of continues sunny days. Those are unable to travel Dubai could also experience the same phenomenon by availing the Morocco holiday packages.These facts at many times may come handy to the people travelling and planning for a wonderful vacation in Dubai.
